io.orchestrate.client

Class RequestException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • io.orchestrate.client.ClientException
            • io.orchestrate.client.RequestException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ApiBadRequestException, InvalidApiKeyException, ItemAlreadyPresentException, ItemVersionMismatchException, PatchConflictException

    public class RequestException
extends ClientException
    An object that stores information about a failed Client request.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getStatusCode

        public int getStatusCode()
        Returns the HTTP status code from the failed request.
        Returns:
        The HTTP status code from the failed request.

      • getRequestId

        public java.lang.String getRequestId()
        Returns the HTTP response ID from the failed request.

        The response ID is used to help with debugging the query in the Orchestrate.io service.

        Returns:
        The HTTP response ID from the failed request.

      • getDetails

        public java.util.Map getDetails()
        If the error from Orchestrate includes a details map, it will be exposed here.
        Returns:
        The details map from the response, or null if there is not one.

      • getLocator

        public java.lang.String getLocator()
        The locator code in the response, if present. The locator code can be useful to help with debugging when working with Orchestrate support.
        Returns:
        The locator code from the response, null if not present.

      • getRawResponse

        public java.lang.String getRawResponse()
        Returns the raw response body that the Orc service returned. This is useful for cases where the orc service introduces new fields in error responses that the client version currently in use does not explicitly expose.
        Returns:
        The raw response body. This will usually be JSON, but in some unexpected cases it may be html or plain text.

      • getInfo

        public java.lang.String getInfo()
        'info' is a commonly included detail for Orchestrate errors. Exposed here for convenience.
        Returns:
        The details.info entry, if present.
